Specify the Project and Folder where the message – driven bean will be placed. The message – driven bean should be stored in the Java source directory, which you specified when you created the EJB Project (for example ejbModule).
Specify the Java package that the class will belong to. Note: The bean class cannot be added into a default package.
Specify the Class name of the message - driven bean (for example MyMessageBean).
In the field Superclass specify the superclass for the message - driven bean, only if it is derived from one. Click Browse to choose from the available, already existing or created, superclasses. (This field is optional).
In the field Destination name specify the global JNDI name of the Queue/Topic JMS Resource.
Check JMS to specify the destination type of the Java Message Service (JMS): - Queue is used as a destination for point–to–point messaging. - Topic is used as a destination for publish/subscribe messaging.

Note that the Class name value provided in the first page of the wizard is automatically mapped to the Bean name field on this page.
In the field Transaction type specify whether the transaction is handled by the Container or the Bean.
Note that, if you specify the destination type of the JMS in the previous page of the wizard, the javax.jms.MessageListener interface is automatically mapped to the Interfaces field on this page. You can click the Add button to add additional interfaces to implement.
If the Inherited abstract methods option is checked, it means that you want to override the methods provided by the interface, which is defined in the Interfaces field.
Using the option Constructors from superclass you can choose whether to override the constructor of the class, which you specified as superclass in the first page of the wizard.
